Abroad Nursing Recruitment Agency in India

  • Why Nursing Jobs in Abroad
  • Qualification for Abroad Nursing Jobs
  • Eligibility Criteria for Abroad Nursing Jobs
  • Nursing Jobs in Top Countries
  • Abroad Nursing Jobs Salary Chart by Country
  • How to Apply Nursing jobs in Abroad

New-Lyf is a well-known overseas nursing recruitment agency in India popular recruitment because of its prompt placement services and delivery of immigration advice in various countries. We provide assistance to the candidates seeking nursing jobs in Canada and nursing jobs in Germany. We assist candidates to search for suitable jobs and other formalities such as visa and immigration formalities.

{/* */}

Why Nursing Jobs in Abroad

The career opportunities in nursing in abroad are very high. There is a huge requirement of skilled and qualified people required for the service. Nursing is the right career option for those candidates who have the zeal and interest to serve mankind. Nursing jobs in abroad are beneficial because of the following reasons:

  • Get Clinical Experience: Nursing overseas such as in Canada and Germany can open up great opportunities to gain different clinical experiences because the candidates will initially be hired to nurse in the specialty in which they currently have experience. They gain experience in alternative techniques and approaches to nursing and healthcare.
  • Earn High Salary: Many countries have a huge demand for nursing and as a result, they often pay a higher salary to nurses.
  • Opportunity To Travel & Explore The World: Nursing jobs in abroad enables the candidates to make their home in a new region of the world and get the opportunity to explore new countries and cultures.
  • Nursing Is A Transferable Job: Moving a nursing career abroad is a realistic option for both experienced and newly registered nurses because there is a worldwide shortage of nurses and they can move around the world to work.
  • Manageable Working Hours: Overseas working nurses have a standard working week of 37.5 hours that makes you a healthy work-life balance. If they want to work extra hours, they will be rewarded with pay enhancements for every hour of overtime you work.
  • On-Site Accommodation: Searching & moving to a new home can be stressful, especially when relocating to a new country. Therefore, the nurses will be provided with one week of free accommodation that allows them to settle when in a new country.
  • Personal Growth: Nursing jobs in abroad provides an opportunity to reflect on their experience with cultural stereotyping while obtaining a better understanding of people of other cultures and ethnicities. Various nurses also experience personal growth that contributes to self-confidence and a sense of autonomy.

Qualification for Abroad Nursing Jobs

  • If the nurses like to move to western countries, they must have at least a bachelor's degree. If they like to move into gulf countries, ANM, GNM qualification is enough with good experience.
  • Nurses should be fluent in the native language. Most western countries speak English as a native language, they need to be good in the English language. They need to qualify English proficiency exams such as IELTS AND TOEFL.
  • If the nurses want to work in Germany, they must know the German language. The minimum requirement for a work permit as a nurse is a B2 level in Germany.
  • If they want to move to Canada, they need to qualify Nursing Licensing exams to work in this country.
  • The salary of the nurses will be good enough depending upon their nursing experience and skills.

Eligibility Criteria for Abroad Nursing Jobs

The eligibility criteria for nursing jobs in Canada and nursing jobs in Germany is given-below:

  • B2 Level of German language is a must for nursing job as they have to communicate with the German patients.
  • The completion of a nursing program that is equivalent to a four-year bachelor's degree in nursing or practical nursing diploma.
  • Nursing practice in the category for which the candidates are applying within three years prior to issuance of the Certificate of Registration.
  • The completion of the NCLEX-RN for those applying for Registered Nurse, or the CPNRE (Canadian Practical Nurse Registration Exam) for those applying for Registered Practical Nurse.
  • Proof of language proficiency in English or French.
Nursing Jobs in Top Countries

There are various top countries where nurses can earn a good salary. Here are some top countries for nursing jobs:

  • United States: The United States has over 3 million Registered Nurses and they work in various industries outside hospitals. Nurses working under the Federal Government are the highest paid with an average annual salary of $87,000. The average annual salary of the registered nurse is $73,500.
  • Germany: There is a huge demand for Nurses in Germany. This country provides a golden opportunity for those candidates who want to build up their career in the field of nursing. If the candidate opts for a nurse vacancy in Germany, it is necessary to get knowledge of the German language because their local language is German and they only can speak in this language. Germany is experiencing a substantial nursing shortage.
  • Canada: Canada is one of the best destinations for international candidates that seek to grow their nursing career in Canada. Nursing jobs in Canada are in huge demand. It includes registered nurses, registered psychiatric nurses, community health nurses, and occupational health nurses. The average salary for a registered nurse in Canada is $60,000 a year.
  • Australia: The average salary of a Registered Nurse in Australia is $56,000. Nurses that work and live outside the major Australian metropolitan area tend to have a higher salary than those who provide services in the more populated communities.
  • Norway: All healthcare practitioners should have formal authorization from the Directorate for Health and Social Affairs. The starting salary for an authorized nurse working is $45,629. A job in any Norwegian healthcare environment will require fluency in Norwegian.

How to Apply Nursing jobs in Abroad

Selecting a nursing career abroad can be financially rewarding. If the candidates have the desire to go abroad for better career prospects then they must have a degree of B.Sc. /M.Sc. Nursing assists them to earn a higher salary as well. There are huge openings in top countries. New-Lyf is one of the best abroad nursing jobs consultancy in India that assists you in applying for nursing jobs abroad. We provide you accurate details and place you in the best country.

Dr Vinit Kumar is a Educational Consultant for India & Abroad with more than 18 Years of Experience. He has an extensive background guiding & assisting medical students to find the best university as per their budget. 3500+ Students 15 Countries MBBS, MBA, PG, UG 100% Commitment Education Loan Job Placements
